arm_group.description: The hour intervention, delivered over a 11-week period, consisted of an empowerment and additional components adapted from Freedom program run to support domestic abused women.
Standard care, which was routine check ups and care provided by health care professionals.

brief_summary.textblock:
Although domestic violence is recognized as major threat in pregnancy, there is no
      intervention has been developed or test to support women in India. To evaluate the effect of
      women's empowerment program administered to abused women in order to reduce domestic abuse,
      improving health status and safety behavior.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Women's Empowerment Program for Abused Pregnant Women

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  at least 18 years of age,

          -  victims of intimate partner violence, and

          -  willing to participate

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  women whose abuser was not their intimate partner or

          -  who were unable to consent

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Women's Empowerment Program for Abused Pregnant Women: A Randomized Controlled Trial

other_outcome.measure: Domestic Violence Inventory and safety seeking behavior

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
